moves.1. e4: Hopefully this helps show how white can dominate this opening. This game is on 21. Rfb1+ the last moves are forced so I don't feel bad about showing this.
moves.1... c6 2. f4 d5 3. Nf3 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: !! This sacrifice is very strong this time around. Due to the presence of the c6 pawn.
moves.9... Qd5: I'm still under the impression that Qe8 is best. I don't like this choice all that much Qd6 looks more appealing that Qd5.
moves.10. Ne6+: Forcing the black king to b6.
moves.10... Kb6 11. d3: Opens line for the dsb and threats blacks king heavily.
moves.11... exd3: The is the first big concession on blacks part its just so slow.
moves.12. Be3+ Ka5: c4 might be slightly better, because it gives blacks king more space to run.
moves.13. a3: keeps black on edge, as will be seen.
moves.14. b4+: Ka6 Nc6# Ka4 Nc3# leaving Kb5
moves.15... Kc4 16. Be6+: Black must block with the queen.
moves.16... Qd5 17. Bxd5+: Taking back with the bishop allows the mate I don't think taking with the knight offers mate.
moves.17... cxd5 18. Nd2+: Push blacks king further up the board away form the undeveloped pieces.
moves.18... Kc3 19. Nb5+: Pushing the king all the way into white territory.
moves.19... Kb2: Kxc2 is also met by O-O. Kxc2 Rc1 Kb2 Bd4# is one mate the other uses the Ra2# idea.

gameName: - - The Annotation Project III - - Whites Ferocity
